definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13/14 LCD issues
threads.message:
I have two displays that I'm wondering if they may be repairable. I tried replacing the connector cables in both with no resolve. Neither appear to have any physical damage. One of them was purchased "new" in July and suddenly is no longer being detected by <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. The other works with the same board but has occasional lines and flicker. Looking at the display logic boards I don't see any visible signs of an issue.

Any likelihood of either being an LCD board repair? or are problems most likely in the ribbon cables or display itself?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13/14 LCD issues
threads.message:
On LCD not being detected the fuse was blown on the LCD display board once that was replaced it was back in working order.

I haven't been able to determine anything with the other. Looks great at first then gets occasional flicker in backlight and also scrolling horizontal lines. The reason I think it may be fixable is it doesn't appear to be related to movement of the display cables or tapping the screen or anything.
